item.title: BCVotes.info
item.description: A website to help citizens find their local candidates and compare party platforms in the BC Provincial Election.

item.title: The Last Skytrain
item.description: A mobile website to simplify the late night train finding experience by rethinking data visualization.

item.title: Ferry Tracker
item.description: An Android app to view the BC Ferries schedule, follow sailings, and be notified about schedule changes.

item.title: CSS Grid Layout Practice
item.description: The following is an exercise I did while teaching myself CSS Grid Layout with the help of Rachel Andrew’s Grid By Example. I thought the new Figma logo could be easily created using only HTML and CSS with Grid Layout. I worked on improving my eye for RGB colour blending by not using an eyedropper tool to get exact values. See the Pen Grid Layout Figma Logo by Dean (@deza604) on CodePen.

item.title: Get in touch!
item.description: Whether it’s feedback on one of my projects or an idea you want to collaborate on, I would love to hear from you! I usually respond to email within a day, and I check social media around once a week. Gotta stay productive! Are you hiring? I’m currently looking for internships or Junior UX/UI roles to improve my skills and tackle new challenges. Send me an email if you might be interested, and we can arrange a time to chat!

item.title: About me
item.description: I am a designer from Vancouver BC currently focused on User Experience and User Interface. I come from an academic background in Psychology. Studying human behaviour has given me invaluable insights, along with research and interviewing skills which I use in my design process. My work history spans industries and job titles and I see my varied experience as a benefit when designing for end users. When I’m not working on my design projects I enjoy learning new songs on guitar, discovering new Celiac friendly foods, and playing with my adopted rabbit Max.
